instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Have yet another board with no power. 20V present but no current draw. Notice PP5V_G3S is unstable and pulsing.

PM_SLP_S4_L - 0.0
PP5V_S5_LDO - 5.03
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H - 12.3 and stable 
PPVIN_G3H_P5VG3S - 12.3 and stable 
PP3V3_G3H - 3.3 and stable


P5VG3S_EN_DLY - pulses also

Any suggestions on this one.

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Any history available?
SSD voltages present?
Did you try DFU?

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
PPVCC_NAND_SSD0 - 0.0

The board does look like it had been cleaned in the past but i can't find any corroded components. 

Yes, i did try DFU and it failed with an error.

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on big coils
Also check at SSD power rails...

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message: what page is the ssd power rail for this model

threads.title: 820-01958: PP5V_g3S Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message: What error do you get on DFU?
